entry.title: inputs: ensure clients support kAlwaysConfirmComposition
entry.content:
Previously in crrev/c/4551404 we added a new extended wayland method

ConfirmComposition. The method is supported in LacrOS but it is not yet

implemented in Crostini.



This method is required when enabling the new behaviour in

InputMethodAsh when the kAlwaysConfirmComposition flag is enabled. If

the new behaviour is executed without the new ConfirmComposition method

being implemented by the client, a severe inputs bug is introduced for

that client (specifically, arrow+select deletes text immediately).



This CL in light of the above adds a necessary check to TextInputClient,

verifying the client does support the new behaviour.



BUG=b:265853952

entry.title: IndexedDB: fix leak of IDBRequest object
entry.content:
This fixes a leak introduced by 2adea2fd2d8df7850b74cf9505d312964.



Prior to that change, WebIDBCallbacksImpl held a reference to the

IDBRequest. This reference was cleared in

IDBRequest::ContextDestroyed() with DetachRequestFromCallback().



Subsequent to the above change, the IDBRequest reference was instead

held by the bound function passed to the mojo remote in WebIDBCursor.

WebIDBCursor is in turn owned by an IDBCursor. Thus an IDBCursor can

keep an IDBRequest alive even after ContextDestroyed(). The culprit

was `IDBRequest::pending_cursor_`, which is not Close()d on errors,

although it is Close()d on valid responses. One apparent fix is to

Close() pending_cursor_ on error as well as valid responses, but since

I'm not sure what side effects that might have, I've opted to just

make the IDBRequest reference held by the mojo result callback weak

instead of strong.



Bug: 1455258

Change-Id: Ie31a92678e9ffe2793cd1139b468bcddc8c702bc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4629423

Reviewed-by: Nathan Memmott

Commit-Queue: Evan Stade

entry.title: Lacros: Allow extension controlled pref read from secondary profile.
entry.content:
Some extensions call chrome.accessibilityFeatures API to read the

value of accessibility features. However, chrome.accessibilityFeatures

is ported for Lacros only for primary profile, the extension code

(e.g. calling chrome.accessibilityFeatures.spokenFeedback.get) breaks

when running in secondary profile in Lacros.



The extension controlled pref already allows onChange event to be

listened by extensions for secondary profile, it is reasonable allow

the pref value to be read from secondary profile as well.



We have not seen the use cases for requiring modifying pref value

from Lacros secondary profile yet, therefore, we will not add such

support for now.



Please find the detailed proposal for exposing a11y features

to be read from the Lacros secondary profiles:

go/a11y-fearure-lacros-secondary-profile

entry.title: [FilesBulkPinning] Use pref instead of Syncing stage for fake status
entry.content:
When the bulk pinning pref is enabled the Files app list view gets

refreshed which grabs the new fake status for folders (i.e. the

available offline tick should show). However the pref sometimes beats

the PinManager updating it state and the available offline tick is now

showing int his case. Instead, prefer to use the pref as the state of

whether bulk pinning is enabled or not instead of the Stage in the

PinManager.

entry.title: wm: Fix a UAF in TransientWindowManager
entry.content:
The tablet mode backdrop can get destroyed as a result of changing

the stacking order. As a result we can't use a stale copy of the

child windows while restacking the transient descendants. We must

track the lifetime of these child windows and exclude the ones that

got destructed during the iterations.

entry.title: Revert "[Pulsing ink drop] Apply pulsing action highlight to all Buttons"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 88b8dacfff061b5a11a19d78b9a5eaef88c6c9b0.



Reason for revert: New highlight makes text fields unreadable.



Bug: 1456528



Original change's description:

> [Pulsing ink drop] Apply pulsing action highlight to all Buttons

>

> Today pulsing highlight is only used by ToolbarButtons when they are anchored an IPH bubble. To apply this effect to all the Buttons and also make this feature serve a general purpose of "draw users attention" rather than a feature specific to IPH, this CL does the following:

>

> 1, Factor out PulsingInkDropMask from ToolbarButton;

> 2, Implement a default pulsing effect in InkDropHost using PulsingInkDropMask and expose ToggleAttentionState(bool) to users that want to toggle a Button's attention on/off;

> 3, IPH uses ToggleAttentionState to toggle its anchored button effect on/off.

>

> This CL also refactors ink_drop_host_unittest to better accommodate attention tests.

>

> Change-Id: I471d870dbaed0fab3208ce43d783a9ee0bfc0010

entry.title: Fix the order of setting `current_bubble_type_` in the mandatory re-auth
entry.content:
opt-in flow



This CL fixes the order of setting `current_bubble_type_` in the

mandatory re-auth opt-in flow, as setting it after running the callback

in the controller can cause us to re-show the opt-in bubble since the

callback is not asynchronous, so the next bubble can be shown before we

get to update the `current_bubble_type_`.



Bug: 1427216

Change-Id: I5fb016057ee6a165a3e8e65f7d155608206b8f88

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4630079

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1160357}

entry.title: Clear browser state for immediately destroyed guests
entry.content:
If a guest is created and then immediately destroyed before the browser

acknowledges creation, then the renderer clears its state, but the

browser leaves the guest alive, pending attachment.



Unattached guests will eventually be destroyed when the embedder is

destroyed, but we should more promptly destroy these guests which we

know will never be attached.



We now have the renderer inform the browser when it destroys an

unattached guest, so that the browser side state can be cleared.



Bug: 1455320

Change-Id: Ief138d12985b469080fb0c6e947f833f28b57498

entry.title: saved_desks: Fix DCHECK when closing ARC window in overview
entry.content:
We have code in OverviewGrid to determine if there are windows that the

saved desk features do not support. This code is run when a window is

added to overview mode, and when it is removed. The issue here is a race

between ARC task and aura window destruction.



We call out to full_restore::GetAppId to get the application ID of a

window. In some cases when an ARC window is being destroyed, this

function will return an empty application ID. The fix here, which is

somewhat temporary, is to also check the window's kAppIDKey property.



BUG=b:270429246



Change-Id: I915e0b0917b0f551dab53e81f8d25425bdbfedd6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4628703

Reviewed-by: Sammie Quon

Commit-Queue: Daniel Andersson

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1160353}

entry.title: Prepare NaCl to be disabled at run time.
entry.content:
This CL has no intended behavior change.



This CL introduces both a field trial and a policy that can be used to

change whether NaCl is enabled. The field trial is the default behavior,

and is currently set to enabled (no behavior change). The policy can be

used to force NaCl to be enabled. This policy will be phased out on M119

on non-ChromeOS platforms, and has no phase out date at the moment for

ChromeOS.



Both the field trial and policy are read early in startup and set as a

command line flag. This ensures that both the browser and the renderer

can correctly determine the state, since plugins are loaded before field

trials are initialized in renderers.



Unfortunately, it is not possible to propagate this logic in a timely

fashion to the zygotes. This means that the zygotes go through the

process of loading plugins, only to be overwritten by renderers

post-fork. Incidentally, this means that utility processes can still

technically load NaCl plugins, although functionally there's no way for

them to do so. As with renderers, it would be possible to propagate the

--disable-nacl flag to them, but there's no point in doing so.



Low-Coverage-Reason: New file has test coverage.

Change-Id: I02d1a1d9c06b8be1f5cc87b57ebd37826a060326

Bug: 1454674

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4611858

Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

Reviewed-by: Sergey Poromov

Commit-Queue: Erik Chen

entry.title: Convert the task manager to use ARC
entry.content:
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/docs/mac/arc.md

for information about this conversion.



Note that this is a change of ownership. Before, the TaskManagerMac

object didn't own the TaskManagerWindowController; the window

controller owned itself. With ARC, Objective-C objects can't really

"own themselves" any more, so ownership was moved to the C++ object.



Bug: 1280317

entry.title: Increase browser_tests on linux-chromeos-dbg by another 20 shards
entry.content:
https://crrev.com/c/4622667 has recently sped the suite up on this

builder. But despite that, a single shard can still sometimes time out.

eg:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-dbg/33259/overview



So this bumps the shard count by 20 to help avoid those time outs.

crbug.com/1447907 is still technically on-file to investigate the

increase in run-time caused by the switch to jammy. (Investigation

still ongoing.)



Note that this builder isn't on the CQ. So capacity impact should

entry.title: Move GetTabBackgroundColor from TabStrip to TabStyle.
entry.content:
This CL is partial progress towards GM3-ifying tab colors.



- Moving GetTabBackgroundColor from TabStrip to TabStyle allows us to have different behavior in GM3 vs GM2 by swapping out the tab style implementations. It also just doesn't make sense for the tabstrip to be in charge of what color tabs are.

- TabStyle::GetTabBackgroundColor takes a new enum TabSelectionState instead of just active or inactive. This lets us handle the alpha stuff in selected tabs inside GetTabBackgroundColor, and will let us have specific colors for selected/hovered states in GM3.



Random related cleanup:

- Tab group highlights were doing weird stuff to paint the selected tab color, now they do less weird stuff.



Remaining work:

- Refactor TabStyleViews to use the TabSelectionState enum directly.

- Add a GM3 override with custom colors for selected and hovered states.



Bug: 1399942

entry.title: Add fullscreen presentation detector to ScreenCaptureKit capturer
entry.content:
This CL adds a module that tracks fullscreen presentations when

ScreenCaptureKit is used on macOS.



The user selects the editor window of the slideshow. Once the

slideshow starts, the module will automatically change what window

is captured so that the fullscreen slideshow is captured.



This feature is already implemented for the current macOS

window capturer. This CL is needed in order to not break this

functionality once we change to use ScreenCaptureKit on macOS.



Internal design doc:

go/macos-fullscreen-feature



The CL is tested on macOS 13.4 with the following applications:

- Microsoft PowerPoint for Mac 16.73

- Apache OpenOffice 4.1.14

- Keynote 13.1



Bug: chromium:1348011

Change-Id: I0ec0311bcf758eb6987f6e30e1d6fee15bcd9302

Low-Coverage-Reason: The reported test coverage is wrong. The newly added module has a high test coverage. The existing code that interacts with the ScreenCaptureKit API is hard to test, I will look into adding tests as a follow up.

entry.title: Support writing shared dictionary from workers
entry.content:
To trigger the shared dictionary writer, we need to set the request's

shared_dictionary_writer_enabled flag. This flag should be enabled when

a valid CompressionDictionaryTransport Origin Trial token is set or

blink::features::kCompressionDictionaryTransport is enabled.



Currently FrameFetchContext is correctly setting this flag.

But WorkerFetchContext is not setting this flag.



This CL changes WorkerFetchContext::PrepareRequest() to set this flag

to support writing shared dictionary from workers.



Bug: 1413922

entry.title: Reland Flags UI: Introduce flags-experiment web component.
entry.content:
This CL contains iOS-specific fixes. It also relands

crrev.com/c/4608803.



This also ports the CSS in crrev.com/c/4575748 which was missed in the

original CL.



This CL

- Adds a new web component (not using Polymer)

to encapsulate the UI for each entry in chrome://flags.

- Implements the `set data() {...}` method to correctly render the

contents of the element.

- Hooks up the new to the existing jstemplate

system (jsselect=...", jsvalues="...") as an incremental step for

eventually fully removing jstemplate usage.

- Rewrites flags logic to account for the flags-experiment shadow DOM.

- Removes CSS and HTML that was rendered obsolete by the above changes.



Performance improvements to this UI will be made in subsequent CL.

entry.title: Reland "DeskButton: Make button responsive to shelf overflow"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 9d5499f1cbca9a4adaee957ef2b83ff6b1eb82a2



This reland fixes the test breakages that caused a revert by ensuring a

consistent time is used for the

ScrollableShelfViewDeskButtonTest.ButtonRespondsToOverflowStateChange

unit test. When the time consists of 4 digits (rather than 3), or has a

date of a different length, this can trigger an unexpected shelf

overflow. Ensuring that each test has the same time makes the test more

robust.



Original change's description:

> DeskButton: Make button responsive to shelf overflow

>

> This CL makes the desk button responsive to shelf overflow. Previously,

> when the shelf was horizontal we would just force it to stay in expanded

> state no matter what. This CL changes this behavior by adding a

> condition where if the shelf will overflow in horizontal alignment with

> the button in the expanded state, then we shrink the button, and vice

> versa. It also adds and updates some tests to account for the changes.

>

> Bug: b/272383056

entry.title: Add ambient video tast test API.
entry.content:
The existing ambient tast test API uses photo transitions as a signal

that ambient mode is successful. This does not apply to video since

there are no photos in the UI. A new method has been added since

entry.title: Make it easier to run build_rust.py --run-xpy
entry.content:
The --run-xpy mode depends on a few set-up steps (including the LLVM

build and config.toml generation), but some of these take a long time

yet only need to run once.



A new arg, --prepare-run-xpy, will run these steps and quit. --run-xpy

will now (almost) immediately run x.py. This removes much of the pain

of interactively testing the build configuration.



The step reordering should not affect the output for a normal build,

so releasing a new toolchain package is not necessary.



Bug: None

entry.content:
This CL is a pure refactor that changes ClipboardHistoryItemView's view

hierarchy so that contents views are added underneath a "display view"

container, and file items' icons are added as siblings rather than

children of contents views. This change allows the ContentsView and

follow-up CL will conditionally add icons for all types of clipboard

history items, not just file items.

entry.content:
It is placehodler for the MP4 Muxer that will inherit Muxer

class, and delegate class that will build the MP4 box.



MP4Muxer class will handle the recorder command such as Pause,

Resume, and passes the incomding encoded stream to the delegate

class where it will build the MP4 data blob.



The change added absl::optional

parameter to the existing API of OnEncodedAudio.

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Remove page display logic from os-settings-section
entry.content:
Previously, os-settings-section included logic to expand or collapse

when a respective subpage was shown. However, fundamentally this

element simply displays a card and its title. The expansion logic is

unnecessary and can be avoided.



This change updates os-settings-section to be a simple card element,

removing any complex display logic. Additionally, since this element

is only used for each top-level page, the element is moved inside each

page's implementation for improved DOM organization. This is done in

preparation for the upcoming category updates in the Wayfinding Revamp.



Bug: b/285968876

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter="OSSettingsMainPageContainer*"

entry.title: RELAND: media/gpu/v4l2: Simplify some V4L2Queue code
entry.content:
Original CL was reverted due to the ARM compiler not liking an

implicit cast.

```

[1700/1950] CXX obj/media/gpu/v4l2/v4l2/v4l2_queue.o

FAILED: obj/media/gpu/v4l2/v4l2/v4l2_queue.o

../../build/cros_cache/chrome-sdk/symlinks/arm64-generic+15502.0.0+target_toolchain/bin/aarch64-cros...(too long)

../../media/gpu/v4l2/v4l2_queue.cc:1150:16: error: non-constant-expression cannot be narrowed from type 'size_t' (aka 'unsigned long') to '__u32' (aka 'unsigned int') in initializer list [-Wc++11-narrowing]

.count = count, .type = type_, .memory = memory, .flags = coherency};

^~~~~

../../media/gpu/v4l2/v4l2_queue.cc:1150:16: note: insert an explicit cast to silence this issue

.count = count, .type = type_, .memory = memory, .flags = coherency};

^~~~~

static_cast<__u32>( )

1 error generated.

```



PS0 contains the original CL and later patches the fix.



Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:lacros-arm64-generic-rel



Original CL description -----------------------------------------------



While working on [1] I found out some code there could be simpler.

This CL extracts that to ease code review. In particular:

- struct v4l2_requestbuffers is a POD and doesn't need memset(0),

can use designated initializers.

- There's no need to DCHECK(!free_buffers_); in the destructor

since the code anyway DeallocateBuffers() immediately after.

- DVQLOGF already prints the queue type, so there's no need to

dump it (as integer, confusingly).



No new functionality intended.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4619074

entry.title: VR: Ensure state restored properly after skia use.
entry.content:
Each time we call SkSurface::flush or GrDirectContext::flush skia might

alter GL state, we need to ensure that we restore relevant state.



Before this CL FBO was restored to the value it was during construction,

and so it's always 0. But the drawing happens to fbo initialized from

shared image for specific draw, and so in cases skia draw was happening

part of browser ui was rendered to offscreen fbo 0.



This CL hides skia code from users, so we know when flush was called

and restores fbo that was bound before flush.



Bug: 1445523

entry.title: [PCCT] startActivityForResult opens PCCT with black background instead of transparent activity
entry.content:
In the case the developer has requested that a PCCT is opened we need to validate that the package name can be retrieved either from the intent or over the service connection. This check happens as part of the CustomTabIntentDataProvider#configureIntentForResizableCustomTab method. When this is called we need to ensure that the EXTRA_CALLING_ACTIVITY_PACKAGE intent extra has already been set. Moving the setting of this intent before #createCustomTabActivityIntent is called.



Follow up: http://crbug.com/1456445 Add Integration test for opening PCCTs using startActivityForResult

entry.title: Drop NOTRACHED in TapSuppressionController::ShouldSuppressTapEnd
entry.content:
NOTREACHED() in `TapSuppressionController::ShouldSuppressTapEnd` is

hit because there is a mouse-up event received after a gesture fling

cancel from touch pad. It happens on ChromeoS and Android so drop

the NOTREACHED.

entry.title: [dPWA] Fix external registration task to check callback
entry.content:
There was a recent CL that caused the callback to be cause async, which

allows for a possible race condition with some of the other callback

triggers. This CL makes sure to check the existence of the callback in

every place we use it, to protect against these race conditions.



R=dibyapal@chromium.org

entry.title: Avoid traversing strings twice when constructing KURLs from GURLs.
entry.content:
`String(const char*)` has to use `strlen()` to determine the length of

the string; however, a `std::string` already knows its length so using

`String(const std::string&)` directly saves a traversal.



Change-Id: If755f71bd6e85580902ff6e8e2b57b7b5987b065

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4628693

Reviewed-by: Jeremy Roman

Commit-Queue: Daniel Cheng

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1160216}

entry.title: [Extensions] Update schemas to the new returns async format
entry.content:
This CL updates the following schemas to update them to the new format

for defining asynchronous returns. Note: These were all bundled together

as they use ErrorWithArguments in some of their API function

definitions. ErrorWithArguments doesn't really make sense in the world

of promises, so when used with a promise and hitting an error these APIs

will just reject the promise with the error and not return any

arguments. If this is a major issue with the functionality of any of

these APIs, those can be followed up on individually.



- mediaGalleries (sans addUserSelectedFolder, which has a multi-param

callback that will need a result handler added)

- notifications

- usb

- gcm

- dashboardPrivate



Bug: 328932

Change-Id: I4c8d9d85cc92011441ae054027faec3d79ddbc89
